intro: Seddera intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate seddera, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows from 10 to 30 centimeters in height, with fleshy, often hairy stems that help it retain moisture. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors including pink, red, and yellow. Seddera intermedia is well adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
